result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas John Keller III

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:49 AM Defendant Thomas John Keller III in court.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Defendant indicates still looking for counsel.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:00 PM    Defendant Thomas John Keller III appeared by phone.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on phone appearance.  Defendant indicates he was in an accident on his return to Wisconsin.  Defendant advises he was in a motorcycle accident this morning, was recently released from the hospital.  Court reschedules matter.  Bond remains in effect.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:09 AM  Defendant Thomas John Keller III appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Court questions defendant on why he's appearing by phone.  Defendant indicates he's out of town taking care of his mental health and addiction issues and his bike broke down, should have bike fixed today or tomorrow.  Court reschedules matter. Bond remains in effect.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Not to possess any firearms.

11:30 AM  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas John Keller III appeared by video from the Door County Jail.   State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 8/29/22 at 10 AM.
Possession of THC/Drug Paraphernalia citations tracking criminal file.
